title: 'Star Wars' cast joins in announcing new products ahead of Triple Force Friday
text:
We may be a week out from Triple Force Friday and even further from the release of "Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker," but that doesn't mean fans can't get a sneak peek at some of the incredible toys heading their way very soon.

Interested in Star Wars? Add Star Wars as an interest to stay up to date on the latest Star Wars news, video, and analysis from ABC News. Add Interest

In advance of the Oct. 4 event -- and the unveiling of the next generation of Star Wars products -- stars from several "Star Wars" projects have been participating in a live event to reveal some of the new products.

Your exclusive first-look at new products from #StarWars: #TheRiseOfSkywalker, #TheMandalorian, and #StarWarsJediFallenOrder in a global reveal livestream is just ahead LIVE @GMA on Facebook and on @starwars on Youtube starting at 2pmET!



Don't miss it! https://t.co/dCuujVrRuK pic.twitter.com/WRVE9GSu13 — Good Morning America (@GMA) September 26, 2019

In addition to "The Rise of Skywalker,” cast members from “The Mandalorian” and “Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order,” like Daisy Ridley, John Boyega and Pedro Pascal, are starting to unveil the products that will come out and be available for purchase at the end of next week.

As the "Star Wars" fan-favorite normally does, Warwick Davis is hosting the livestream and welcoming past actors like Anthony Daniels and Billy Dee Williams on to announce what fans can expect.

Davis said the name Triple Force Friday stems from the fact that it will be, "Three times bigger and three times better!"

Already revealed was the D-O Interactive Droid from Hasbro.

Much like the beloved BB-8 interactive Droid from a few years back, D-O can be controlled through an app on your smartphone or tablet. Plus, it's super cute.

Disney

According to the official description, "Cobbled from odds and ends in the workshop of a droidsmith, D-O is an impressionable little roller that becomes fixated upon BB-8."

You can check this droid out later this year in "The Rise of Skywalker," out on Dec. 20.

Hasbro also teased on Twitter Thursday a Black Series Luke Skywalker figure.

That will be out this fall.

Also revealed on the stream was Cameron Monaghan's new role as Cal Kestis in the upcoming game, "Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order."

The "Gotham" star got his own figurine, to which he said, "Can I just go play with this for a while!"

A Funko bobblehead was also debuted and the game itself for X-Box One.

Monaghan also played an exclusive trailer!

The dark side seeks to eradicate the light. Only you can hold it at bay in #StarWarsJediFallenOrder.



Learn more, here: https://t.co/IMUitMW2RB pic.twitter.com/65YCB5Imbv — EA Star Wars (@EAStarWars) September 26, 2019

'The Rise of Rey'

Ridley got a chance to see several versions of her "Rise of Skywalker" hero Rey.

"No Way!" she said when seeing herself immortalized in multiple figurines.

She even got a chance to see her Lego Rey.

AHHHH HELLO TRIPLE FORCE FRIDAY pic.twitter.com/9Zm7ZP2AXO — kesha debicki (@jjaibrams) September 24, 2019

📸 | Screencaptures da Daisy participando da revelação dos novos produtos de Star Wars na live do Triple #ForceFriday. pic.twitter.com/GR776mlW5F — Daisy Ridley Brasil Mídias (@MidiasDRBR) September 26, 2019

The livestream and product reveals are ongoing, so check back for more big reveals!

Fans are excited and sharing pictures of all the fun!

Voici le set complet The Rise Of Skywlaker ! #StarWars pic.twitter.com/HuTLIFZxhz — Zorba80128📺📽🎮 (@mvl_zorba80128) September 26, 2019

ABC News and Lucasfilm are both part of parent company Disney.
description: A week ahead of Triple Force Friday, several exciting
